column4: hey has anyone else noticed openoffice word processor interfering with compiz fusion?
nope
are you using the gnome-do doc? like Awn?
yes, that is what is freaking out the most, but both the OO.o window and other window borders freak out a little too
have you tried gnome-do without the doc to see if it's something the doc is doing?
no I just noticed it, let me try that

alright I have tried what you suggest it, I can narrow it down to  OO.o because when I close docky, windows still behave improperly, as in when I hover over the minimize, max and close buttons it causes the window border on any window to phase in and out of visibility
perhaps you'll also need to restart OO
yea,  tried that same issue, I actually closed all my programs and restarted everything, in fact thats how I found the problem
do you have java turned on in the OO setup?
uh no, I actually dont know anything about that, OO is written in java?
nevermind.. you have to turn it on, on purpose.. not really needed.. still.. it might be that 177 driver you're using.  I really didn't like that one.. have you tried the 173 or the 180.11?

huh, funny update, it only seems to cause problems when openoffice has focus, and I really dont want to mess with my video drivers, I did before and it was a nightmare to get my settings back, so if thats really all we can come to as the problem I will just deal with it, its nvidia's proprietary crap and not ubuntus
k.. you might ask in OO's channel as well.. they might know something that we don't here.
I will try but I suspect there will be few linux users there, thank you for all your help and thought
np.. you'd be supprised.. I've had good exprience there.
thanks, which channel is that exactly?
I believe it's #openoffice.org but I'm not sure what server.. you'll have to check their site
didn't ask.. do you have compiz turned on?

ah, its not on freenode, lol this server is all I ever IRC on, I forgot there were others! LOL yes I have compiz turned on, I actually used the compiz-icon to reload compiz and switch between metacity and compiz, so I know for darn sure its on
does the issue persist after turning compiz off?
no, it does not, but the gnome-do bar does not like the lack of compiz
catch 22 if you know what that is.
indeed, and I do know
